page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: This is an area of outstanding natural beauty with a rugged coastline,well known as a tourist attraction.There are many beaches including Mawgan Porth and Beacon Cove.There are also inland walks along the Vale of Lanherne following high hedged narrow roads or across fields to St.Mawgan village and Carnanton Woods. The remains of an iron age cliff castle can be seen on the cliffs south of Beacon Cove,but most of the more modern buildings are along the coastal road .Much of the inland area is farmland and residents are dependent on nearby Newquay or St.Columb Major for major services and transport is vital for those living here. The character of our area changes dramatically from winter to summer when the population is increased by holiday makers.
